description: By analogy to phyllotaxy, substituting the prefix chaeto- from Greek χαίτη (khaítē); surface analysis, chaeto- +‎ -taxy (compare taxis).

entries.meaning: (zoology) The arrangement of, and study of arrangement of, chaetae (chitinous bristles) on a species or subspecies of animal, usually and especially an arthropod or annelid.
